ud5.7:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud5.7:1.3: Now at that time Venerable Revata the Doubter was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight, reviewing his own purification through overcoming doubt.
ud5.7:2.1: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ud5.7:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud5.7:4.1: “Any doubts about this world or the world beyond,
ud5.7:4.2: about one’s own experiences or those of another:
ud5.7:4.3: those who meditate give them all up,
